page.title: List of recurring The Simpsons characters

rev.comment: rm indiscriminate re-addition of non-free content, in violation of [[WP:NFLISTS]]
rev.diff:
Line 235: Line 235:
==Sea Captain==
==Sea Captain==
â
[[Image:Captain McCallister.png|175px|thumb|Captain McCallister.]]
 
'''Horatio McCallister''', more commonly known as "'''The Sea Captain'''", is voiced by [[Hank Azaria]].<ref name="Richmond178"/> Azaria modelled the voice on actor [[Robert Newton]], who played pirates in several movies.<ref>Azaria, Hank (2004). Commentary for "[[New Kid on the Block]]", in ''The Simpsons: The Complete Fourth Season'' [DVD]. 20th Century Fox.</ref> The writers' "love of sea talk" is what inspired them to invent the Sea Captain.<ref>Martin, Jeff (2003). Commentary for "[[I Married Marge]]", in ''The Simpsons: The Complete Third Season'' [DVD]. 20th Century Fox.</ref> His character is based on the stereotype of sailors and pirates, including the stereotypical pirate catchphrase, "Yarr!" He is a member of the Springfield [[Alcoholics Anonymous]] and has a peg leg in which he keeps liquor. In "[[The Bart of War]]" he uses his wooden leg to have a vicious sword fight with [[List of media personalities in The Simpsons#Sideshow Mel|Sideshow Mel]]'s bone.<ref name="BartofWar"/>
'''Horatio McCallister''', more commonly known as "'''The Sea Captain'''", is voiced by [[Hank Azaria]].<ref name="Richmond178"/> Azaria modelled the voice on actor [[Robert Newton]], who played pirates in several movies.<ref>Azaria, Hank (2004). Commentary for "[[New Kid on the Block]]", in ''The Simpsons: The Complete Fourth Season'' [DVD]. 20th Century Fox.</ref> The writers' "love of sea talk" is what inspired them to invent the Sea Captain.<ref>Martin, Jeff (2003). Commentary for "[[I Married Marge]]", in ''The Simpsons: The Complete Third Season'' [DVD]. 20th Century Fox.</ref> His character is based on the stereotype of sailors and pirates, including the stereotypical pirate catchphrase, "Yarr!" He is a member of the Springfield [[Alcoholics Anonymous]] and has a peg leg in which he keeps liquor. In "[[The Bart of War]]" he uses his wooden leg to have a vicious sword fight with [[List of media personalities in The Simpsons#Sideshow Mel|Sideshow Mel]]'s bone.<ref name="BartofWar"/>
